title: R45321
content: The Trump Administration requested $76.2 billion for the Department of Transportation (DOT) for FY2019, proposing significant cuts in funding for various programs. The House Committee on Appropriations recommended $87.8 billion for DOT, while the Senate passed a bill providing $86.6 billion. The Senate passed H.R. 6147 on August 1, 2018, which includes the FY2019 THUD appropriations bill providing $86.6 billion in new budget authority for the Department of Transportation (DOT). This amount is slightly above the FY2018 level and significantly higher than the Administration's request.
